description:
Enabling security & establishing trust are fundamentally different in mobile devices compared to traditional PC world. Combining “mobile” and “payment” worlds results in a system with strict security requirements and stringent limitations on usability and implementation perspectives. This session proposes creative ideas to achieve a secure and Usable authentication for mobile payment.

Session Learning Objectives:
   • What are the business problems that could be solved easier with this model?
   • Tackling the mobile payment primary issue: establishing the end-to-end trust
   • Drawing on other examples between mobile infrastructure and a distributed computing environment
   • Cloud computing security and how it could help mobile payment
   • Distinguish authentication differences between Mobile and traditional PC world
   • Identify various mobile payment ecosystem players and their roles in authentication
   • Determine the role of Mobile Operating System in the strength of mobile payment solutions
   • Recognize the critical usability aspects of security on mobile devices
   • Construct an end-to-end strong authentication, suitable for mobile payment

   • Sponsored by PayPalx
title: Mobile Payment and mCommerce Security: What They Mean and How to Implement Them
